Flub.Name: Impact
Flub.Description: The intensity of the process. Higher values create stronger physical impacts within the erosion process.

Flub.Name: Flow Width
Flub.Description: The relative width of the areas impacted by the erosion.

Flub.Name: Erosion Depth
Flub.Description: The influence or depth of the downcutting caused by the erosion.

Flub.Name: Flow
Flub.Description: The style of the downcutting in the erosion process.

Flub.Name: Destructive
Flub.Description: Tiny, small scale roughening of the entire surface with higher impact on steep slopes.

Flub.Name: Pits
Flub.Description: Larger pit like impacts that overlap often, biased slightly towards existing flow structures.

Flub.Name: Flows
Flub.Description: Deepen existing flow structures and create new minor ones.

Flub.Name: Rivers
Flub.Description: Deepen existing flow structure in major river flow zones only.

Flub.Name: Rivers x2
Flub.Description: A powerful version of the Rivers mode.

Flub.Name: Rivers x4
Flub.Description: An extreme version of the Rivers mode.

Flub.Name: Flooding
Flub.Description: Intense low-altitude, low-slope, destructive mode. Use sparingly.

Flub.Name: Flooding x2
Flub.Description: A more powerful version of Flooding. May not work with some terrains.

Flub.Name: Flooding x4
Flub.Description: An extreme version of Flooding. May not work with some terrains.

Flub.Name: Accuracy
Flub.Description: The accuracy of the simulation. You can speed up the simulation by lowering the accuracy.
